Visualization options (concise):
- Line chart (hourly series): good for temperature, radiation; libraries: Chart.js, Lightweight-Charts, or native SVG.
- Bar chart: use for precipitation / snowfall per hour (stacked bars possible).
- Area chart: shows cumulative or smooth trends (temperature ranges).
- Sparklines / small multiples: tiny inline charts for quick comparison across days.
- Heatmap / calendar view: dense hourly data over many days ‚Äî good for pattern spotting (e.g., precipitation intensity over time).
- Interactive timeline with hover tooltips and zoom: use D3.js or Plotly for interactivity.
- Micro-interactions: color-coded weather codes (sunny/cloudy/rain icon) on the time axis to add quick visual cues.

- Start simple: add Chart.js and render a responsive line chart for hourly temperature and a bar chart for hourly precipitation. It's easy to integrate and looks good.
- If you want very lightweight, implement sparkline SVGs for each panel first, then add Chart.js later.
